intro: Haplophyllum elatum, commonly known as the broadleaf hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features basal leaves that are broad and heart-shaped, with hairy surfaces. It produces yellow flowers in late summer, which are arranged in a single, flat head. Haplophyllum elatum is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments.
